title.narrative: South Sudan Enhancing Community Resilience and Local Governance Project

description.narrative: To improve access to basic infrastructure and to strengthen community institutions in selected counties in South Sudan.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2 Section I.A.1: Within sixty (60) days from the Effective Date, the Recipient shall establish, and thereafter maintain atall times during the implementation of the Project, a Project Management Unit (“PMU”) at the national level, with functions,staffing and resources satisfactory to the Association, and responsible for overall implementation of the Project and forcoordination of implementation of Project activities.

Schedule 2 Section I.B.1: The Recipient shall furnish the draft PIM to the Association for review and approval and thereafter,implement Project in accordance with the PIM approved by the Association and except as the Association shall otherwise agree inwriting, the Recipient shall not amend, abrogate, or waive or fail to enforce any provision of the said PIM.

Schedule 2 Section I.B.3: Within three (3) months from the Effective Date, the Recipient shall hire a Third-Party Monitoring Agent,in accordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association, including quarterly reporting by said agent.

Schedule 2 Section I.B.4: The Recipient shall no later than three (3) months from the Effective Date, or establish and thereaftercarry out the Project, a grievance redress mechanism, and a management information system, under terms and structure satisfactoryto the Association.

Schedule 2 Section I.B.5: The Recipient shall:(a) implement activities under Part 1 of the Project in accordance with criteriaand procedures set out in the PIM, including selection of Counties, Payams and Bomas for participation in the Project, selection ofSubprojects to be implemented in selected Counties and ensure that Subprojects do not include activities in the negative list setout in the PIM; (b) prior to implementation of any Project activities in any County selected in accordance with the PIM, sign aMemorandum of Understanding with the Ministry of Finance and Planning and the Local Government Board, setting out the overall scopeof the Project activities and responsibilities of Recipient, IOM and the Government of South Sudan;(c) prior to implementation ofany Project activities in each County selected in accordance with the PIM, enter into a Memorandum of Understanding, with IOM andsaid County setting out the commitment of the County government to participate in and support the Project, the role of the Countygovernment, and the coordination mechanism between the County government, UNOPS and IOM; (d) prior to commencing any civil worksunder a Subproject selected in accordance with the PIM, enter into an agreement and/or or cause IOM to enter into an agreement,with the County government and the PDC concerned, setting out the agreed list of priority infrastructure selected by thecommunities (“Payam Priority List”) within the relevant Payam to be included the Subproject; and (e) ensure that upon thecompletion of civil works under each Subproject, enter into, and/or cause IOM to enter into, an agreement with the County and thePDC concerned, setting out the County government's official ownership of the Subproject assets and the division of responsibilitiesfor the operation and maintenance of said Subproject assets between the County and the PDC concerned (“Handover Agreement”).

Schedule 2 Section I.B.6: The Recipient shall enter into contractual arrangements with IOM in accordance with the Procurement Plan(“UNOPS-IOM Agreement”) and the Recipient shall exercise its rights under the UNOPS-IOM Agreement in such manner as to protect theinterests of the Recipient and the Association and to accomplish the purposes of the Financing.

Schedule 2 Section II.A.1: The Recipient shall furnish to the Association each Project Report (i.e., a progress Project Reportproviding for a summary of activities covering a period of three (3) calendar months, and a detailed annual Project Report), notlater than forty-five (45) days after the end of the period covered by such report.

Schedule 2 Section II.A.2: The Recipient shall furnish to the Association not later than five (5) days from receipt by Recipientof each quarterly report from the Third-Party Monitoring Agent, prepared in accordance with terms of reference acceptable to theAssociation, including that such report shall contain a summary of findings regarding adherence, at all implementation levels, tothe procedures set out in relevant Project documents, and verification of all Project activities.

Schedule 2 Section II.B.3: The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association, interim unaudited financial reports relatedto the Project (to reflect the Project operations, resources and expenditures), in accordance with accounting standards establishedpursuant to the Financial Regulations and in the format agreed with the Association. The first said interim unaudited financialreport for the Project shall cover the period from the incurrence of the first expenditure under the Financing through the end ofthe first three-month period following the Effectiveness Date. Thereafter, each interim unaudited financial report shall befurnished to the Association not later than forty-five (45) days after each subsequent quarterly period and shall cover suchquarterly period.

Schedule 2 Section II.B.4: The Recipient shall have the financial statements of the Project audited in accordance with (i) Article6 of the Financial Regulations and (ii) the Financial Management Framework Agreement. Each audit of the financial statements shallcover the period of one fiscal year of the Recipient, commencing with the fiscal year in which the first withdrawal of Financingwas made. The audited financial statement for each such period shall be furnished to the Bank not later than six (6) months afterthe end of such period.
